page.title: 01KINNERTON, EVENJOBB RESUME
page.content: KINNERTON AND EVENJOBB ARE SITUATED IN THE RADNOR VALLEY, THE LAND RISES TO 12OO FT IN THE EAST, MIXED FARMING IS PRACTISED, SHEEP AND CATTLE ARE REARED AND SOME CEREALS ARE GROWN. OFFA'S DYKE RUNS FROM BURFA (WHERE THE OLDEST DWELLING IS SITUATED) OVER EVENJOBB HILL THROUGH FARMLAND OF OUTSTANDING BEAUTY. POPULATION IS 225 MOSTLY EMPLOYED IN AGRICULTURE OR RETIRED FROM WORK, THERE IS LITTLE UNEMPLOYMENT. THERE ARE TWO CHURCHES 1 CHAPEL, 2 POST BOXES AND 2 TELEPHONE KIOSKS. THE 26 CHILDREN OF SCHOOL AGE ATTEND RADNOR VALLEY COUNTY PRIMARY SCHOOL AND JOHN BEDDOE'S SCHOOL. TRANSPORT IS PROVIDED TO SCHOOL, LOCAL BUS SERVICES RUN TWICE A WEEK TO KINGTON FOR SHOPPING. RESIDENTS ARE ENGLISH SPEAKING, MANY FAMILIES HAVE LIVED IN THE SAME AREA FOR GENERATIONS.
